item.title: Juneteenth Corvette Caravan with Jiten Daiko
item.description: Pieces Played: Matsuri Daiko and Bujinn (not shown) Performers (by solo order): Will Tokunaga Kohtaro Yamakawa Amy Zou Kyle Graycar Joel Graycar Shime: Susanna Elledge Galen Rogers Narimono: Tyler Devlin Taught by: Isaku Kageyama Video Shot by: Ali Kakawa Location: 762 Fulton Street at Juneteenth Corvette caravan Thoughts on my playing: Keep head up during the oroshi Don’t sway your hips so muchduring karaka M3 arm needs to be bigger loop Use more gravity to hit and less acceleration More ma during B section and more spacious rhythms Let the build be more flowy and less erratic More flashy/poses overall Create that golden moment by letting the bachi drop from the furthest point and contorting at the last Better lines on your feet: don’t lift the tips of your feet, just heel Glide, don’t just move Slower raise of the bachi, use delay and twirls to build atmosphere Way better than before LA trip but not quite where I want to be.
